GOVERNOR WENTWORTH REGIONAL SCHOOL DISTRICT - SAU 49
The Governor Wentworth Regional School District (GWRSD) serves the communities of Brookfield, Effingham, New Durham, Ossipee, Tuftonboro, and Wolfeboro.

font.a: 09/18/19: Letter to parents explaining a change to the 2019-2020 calendar.

div.br:
April 16, 2020
Dear Families,
Governor Sununu has just extended the closing of all schools in the state until the end of the school year. We know this will present challenges to families and we will assist you to the best of our ability. We have been anticipating this possibility and have been conferring about how we might provide closure to the school year and a positive transition for your children to the next school year. This will include some alternative activities for some of our usual traditions. Information will come from your individual schools as we work out the details. Thank you for your support for your children and the school district as we navigate these challenging times.
Sincerely,
Kathleen Cuddy-Egbert
Superintendent of Schools

td.div:
The mission of the Governor Wentworth Regional School District is to assure that each student acquires knowledge and develops skills and work habits to enable them to become contributing members of society.
The mission is best accomplished when each member of the Governor Wentworth Regional School District recognizes and addresses the individual abilities and needs of each student, maintains challenging expectations for each student, creates a positive school climate, ensures a safe and orderly school environment, monitors each student's progress on a frequent basis, and promotes effective school - community involvement collaboration.
The vision of the Governor Wentworth Regional School District is stated as: “Helping Each Child Create the Future.”
